title: On Telegram, Russian messengers of war
summary: Since Russia's invasion of Ukraine, the number of channels run by Russian 'war correspondents' has soared into the thousands on Telegram. These new propagandists assist in radicalizing the 'special military operation' initiated by Vladimir Putin.

title: Putin says he's open to peace deals, but only 'based on the realities on the ground' in Russian-occupied territories of Ukraine
summary: The Kremlin leader spoke at the end of the BRICS summit in the city of Kazan, where he faced calls from some of Russia's most important allies for the fighting in Ukraine to end. Putin also held talks with United Nations Secretary-General Antonio Guterres in the pair's first meeting since April 2022.

title: Silence from the ICC judges hearing the Netanyahu case
summary: Issued by the prosecutor five months ago, the judges of the International Criminal Court are due to rule on the request for an arrest warrant against the Israeli prime minister.

title: Gisèle Pelicot, invincible even against 'lowest depths of the human soul'
summary: 'I'm not expressing anger or hatred. I'm expressing my determination to change this society,' the former wife of Dominique Pelicot, repeatedly sedated by her husband so he and dozens of men could rape her, told the court on Wednesday.

title: LA prosecutor says will ask for resentencing of Menendez brothers over parents' killing
summary: Los Angeles County District Attorney George Gascón announced a decision on Thursday in the case of brothers Erik and Lyle Menendez, who have spent 34 years in prison for the shotgun murder of their parents.

title: 'I'm not coming with the same charisma as Hervé Renard': Laurent Bonadei, the little-known coach who whispers in the ear of football's Bleues
summary: The 54-year-old former assistant coach, who coached youth teams for 16 years, is making his debut as No.1 with the French women's team against Jamaica in Sochaux on Friday.

title: Israel and Hamas signal openness on talks to end Gaza war
summary: After a meeting in Cairo, Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said he welcomed Egypt's readiness to reach a deal 'for the release of the hostages' still held by militants in Gaza, then directed the head of Israel's Mossad spy agency to leave for key mediator Qatar on Sunday to 'advance a series of initiatives,' a statement from his office said.

title: Lebanon's ancient city of Baalbek bears the scars of Israeli bombs
summary: Strikes have killed 50 people in the city known both for its Roman temples and as a Hezbollah stronghold.

title: French conference on aid to Lebanon raises $1 billion in pledges
summary: Representatives from 70 countries and organizations gathered in Paris on Thursday to pledge $800 million in humanitarian aid and $200 million for Lebanon's security forces.

title: Environmental activist fined for deflating SUV tires in Paris
summary: Maxime D. would insert lentils into the tire valves of these vehicles to call out the pollution they cause. He was fined €300.

title: Paul Watson, speaking from his Greenland prison: 'I want France to be our home'
summary: The defender of the oceans is still in detention in Greenland pending a decision on his extradition to Japan, the Nuuk court ruled on Wednesday. In France, mobilization is growing in support of the activist.

title: Climate: Greenhouse gas emissions are too high, pushing planet toward +3.1°C warming
summary: Greenhouse gas emissions are still too high to limit the rise in global temperatures below the thresholds set by the Paris Agreement, warns the United Nations Environment Program, two weeks ahead of COP29 in Baku, Azerbaijan.

title: Macron and the dangers of 'bluster' diplomacy
summary: Despite the many setbacks he has encountered, the French president claims to still play a key role in what he considers to be his 'reserved domain:' the international stage.

title: Pro-Palestinian protests lose steam on American campuses
summary: As elsewhere in the country, students and faculty at the University of Missouri were disciplined following the spring protests. Despite criticizing the Biden administration's Middle East policy, Democratic activists may still decide to vote for Kamala Harris.

title: Western officials confirm North Korean troops have been deployed in Russia
summary: NATO and Washington said they have proof of the dispatch of North Korean troops to Russia, announced a few days ago by Seoul and Kyiv. They have not confirmed whether these soldiers are expected to go fight in Ukraine.

title: French government orders displaced Ukrainians to give up subsidized accommodation
summary: In the Grand-Est region, Ukrainians who have fled the war are receiving letters asking them to leave their homes, on the grounds that they have not integrated. This measure has provoked anger in Ukrainian groups.

title: Trump likened to a 'fascist' by General John Kelly, his former chief of staff
summary: 'He certainly prefers the dictator approach to government,' said Kelly, confirming the White House candidate's fascination with Hitler. 'This is a window into who Donald Trump really is,' commented his Democratic rival, Kamala Harris.

title: Insect population collapse is grossly underestimated by high-profile work
summary: Two researchers identified methodological and statistical errors in the largest database on global changes in invertebrate populations, cited in more than 1,000 subsequent studies.
